intro.heading: About Me
paragraphs: I am Min-Chieh (Joe) Ku, a graduate of the Graduate Institute of Information Management at National Taipei University. I have experience with multiple programming languages, including Java, Python, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and SQL, and have worked with object-oriented programming. I am also familiar with frameworks like Spring and Flask, as well as containerization technologies such as Docker. In the field of cloud technology, I hold certifications including AWS CCP, SAA, ML, and Microsoft AI-900. I completed my undergraduate studies in the Department of Product Design at Ming Chuan University, where I developed a foundation in UI/UX design.

Before attending graduate school, I worked as a B2B sales representative at an equipment manufacturing company. My role focused on meeting customer needs, facilitating contract signings, and providing customer service. Within six months, I contributed to 20% of the company's total sales target. My goal is to apply my knowledge in information management and previous sales experience to the technology industry.

papers.title: Research on Scheduling and Allocation for Unmanned Taxi Dispatch Services.
bullets: Through designing a ride-matching algorithm in a Java-based simulation environment, a ride-matching system for unmanned taxis was developed.
Using object-oriented design, each role is abstracted as an independent object, calculating the next event's occurrence time and storing it in an ArrayList as an event queue.
The algorithm focuses on the matching problem of multiple customers and multiple vehicles, with each vehicle being paired with only one customer.
The algorithm considers the customers' tolerable waiting times and different vehicle dispatch methods, reducing the overall average waiting time and the worst-case waiting time.

projects.title: My Personal Website
bullets: List previous educational background, work experience, projects, certifications, skills, familiar frontend, backend, and database technologies, and language abilities.

This website was developed using Docker technology and deployed on AWS. It runs containers on EC2 using Docker Compose. The frontend and backend are built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Java, and Spring Boot, with MySQL as the database.
The GitHub Page frontend design is the same as that of the personal-website project and is hosted using GitHub's free static domain service.

projects.title: Cat Breed Detect
bullets: catbreeddetect.com is a web-based application designed to predict the breed of a cat from an uploaded image, utilizing a trained deep learning model for accurate classification.
The model is developed using the Cat Breeds Dataset from Kaggle and is capable of classifying cat images into 67 distinct breeds.
The application is containerized using Docker and Docker Compose and deployed on AWS ECS (Fargate).

projects.title: TrainGymPT
bullets: TrainGymPT is a conversational AI fitness assistant application that provides exercise recommendations based on user queries.
This app combines NLP models for intent classification and dialogue generation.

work.title: Project Product Salesperson
bullets: Assisted in preparing documents for sales, such as equipment specification sheets, operation manuals, equipment selection guides, site planning documents, benefit calculation reports, and quotations.
Supported equipment design tasks, responsible for designing nameplates, brand logo stickers, and operation labels.
Participated in product design, including new shapes, functional concept designs, and equipment site planning designs.

Collaborated with sales during client visits to conduct site surveys, measure equipment installation areas, and plan water, electricity, and gas connections and pathways, while documenting all details meticulously.
Successfully secured over 10 equipment sales contracts and contributed to 20% of the company's sales target in the final six months.
